title: Maximum Depth of Binary Tree
description:
Given the root of a binary tree, return its maximum depth. A binary tree's maximum depth is the number of nodes along the longest path from the root node down to the farthest leaf node.

Example:
  Input: root = [3,9,20,null,null,15,7]
  Output: 3

Constraints:
- The number of nodes in the tree is in the range [0, 10000]
- -100 <= Node.val <= 100
test_code:
require 'minitest/autorun'
require_relative 'solution'

class TestMaximumDepthOfBinaryTree < Minitest::Test
  def test_basic
    root = TreeNode.new(3, TreeNode.new(9), TreeNode.new(20, TreeNode.new(15), TreeNode.new(7)))
    assert_equal 3, max_depth(root)
  end
  def test_two_levels
    root = TreeNode.new(1, nil, TreeNode.new(2))
    assert_equal 2, max_depth(root)
  end
  def test_empty
    assert_equal 0, max_depth(nil)
  end
  def test_single_node
    assert_equal 1, max_depth(TreeNode.new(1))
  end
end
